Don't infinite loop Snag The Trophies stage in single player mode
Hacky bug fix. Just stops the branches at these locations. No idea what this does.
[_glook]
Revision ---- DOL Offset ---- Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code -
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x216394 ------ 4182FFE0 -> 60000000
-------------- 0x2581B8 ------ 481350C5 -> 60000000


	-==-


Tournament Overtime (SDR Staticly placed @ 80191484)
Breaks ties by percent in regulation and makes sudden death mode a normal 3 minute match.
[_glook]
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18E064 -----

	-==-


Ledge Invincibility Attrition (SDR Statically placed @ 80191768)
This basically make ledge invincibility behave similarly to shields, in that after grabbing the ledge a few times in quick succession, subsequent grabs will reduces ledge invincibility. The ledge invincibility recovers over time, like shields, and is reset when you die, just like shields. (I figure this is a better solution that the one PM has, not only because I feel it feels more natural, but also because of things like the haxdash that can circumvent it. - _glook)
Notes: http://smashboards.com/threads/melee-gecko-codes-guide-and-discussion.327311/page-35#post-19218896
[_glook]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18E348 -----
DBE10040 BF61002C 7C7B1B78 4BFFDEC1 3BC30000 387B0000 4BFFDEAD 801E0000
83BB0028 2C000009 3B7D0000 41800014 387B0000 38800010 481E05FD 48000134
387B0000 38800010 481E07ED 281D0000 4082000C 38000000 48000008 801D0010
90010014 80610014 28030000 4082000C 38600000 48000008 80630008
->

7C862050 7CE33B78 4BF09100 807F198C 809F1988 7C632378 2C030000 40820018
807F1068 2C030000 41A2000C 3863FFFF 907F1068 807F1990 4BED8C38


	-==-


Wall Bracing (SDR Statically placed @ 801917E4)
Its main purpose is to get rid of wall infinites.
If you are on the ground and you're moving into a wall (either by purposely walking/running into it or, more likely, if you're being shined into the wall), if you get hit by a non-launching attack, you can press the analog stick left or right to brace against the wall, which will make your feet leave the ground. The direction you press doesn't matter, and this was purposefully done to help with Smash DI (which is actually just a justification for my laziness. - _glook).
[_glook]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18E3C4 -----
28030000 4082000C 38600000 48000008 80630008 28030000 4082000C 38000000
48000008 80030008 28000000 9001000C 4082000C 38000000
->
2C1C0003 41820030 887D0724 70630004 2C030004 40A20020 807D0620 2C030000
4082000C 38600001 48000008 38600000 2C030000 4BEFC798


	-==-


Capped (Tennis) Mode (SDR Statically placed @ 8019181C)
treats the Stock Match Time Limit as a points cap in Time mode and a coin cap in Coin Mode (coin cap is the minutes set times 100). It essentially ends the match immediately once one of the players has reached the point or coin limit/cap. Setting Stock Match Time Limit to None turns this off, so you can still play normally if you want to.
[_glook]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18E3FC -----

Disable Tap Jump (SDR Statically placed @ 80191930)
Affects all players
[Achilles]

Random Hitbox Elements - Every Non-projectile Attack (SDR Statically placed @ 8019195C)
All Non-projectile attacks will have a random effect, rather than their normal one.
[Achilles]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18E53C -----

28000009 4BEDFC14


	-==-


Flush Cache on Scene Change
When scene changes, the Dolphin cache should flush (so any on the fly code changes apply).
SDR Note: This is a bit of a hack, as code shouldn't really be rewritten on the fly. So we shouldn't need this after we re-write all of our toggles to toggle based off variables instead.
[Dan Salvato]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x1A1750 ------ 4E800020 -> Branch
3C608000 3C80003C 3D808000 618C543C
7D8903A6 4E800420 48000000
